Redux Resources

# 

<span key="ab83f2b55fad4189a059c25874d3dbca"><span offset-key="ab83f2b55fad4189a059c25874d3dbca:0">Learning Resources</span></span>

<span key="be876cc0451e44629983e22b5473be09"><span offset-key="be876cc0451e44629983e22b5473be09:0">The Redux docs are intended to teach the basic concepts of Redux, as well as explain key concepts for use in real-world applications. However, the docs can't cover everything. Happily, there are many other great resources available for learning Redux. We encourage you to check them out. Many of them cover topics that are beyond the scope of the docs, or describe the same topics in other ways that may work better for your learning style.</span></span>

<span key="5c9cba08ed5c43c88898c54608185cb8"><span offset-key="5c9cba08ed5c43c88898c54608185cb8:0">This page includes our recommendations for some of the best external resources available to learn Redux. For an additional extensive list of tutorials, articles, and other resources on React, Redux, Javascript, and related topics, see the </span></span><a href="https://github.com/markerikson/react-redux-links" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b7680331e06247bf8f20f751806c7001" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="332851556ae94388b45191572b8a7cdb"><span data-offset-key="332851556ae94388b45191572b8a7cdb:0">React/Redux Links list</span></span></span></a><span key="b773c07991ce474599c47438d288c05c"><span offset-key="b773c07991ce474599c47438d288c05c:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="22d61060d17148eabcacf0afeb3f17cf"><span offset-key="22d61060d17148eabcacf0afeb3f17cf:0">Basic Introductions</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/learning-resources#basic-introductions" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="18fe8c096fd9475286701b78cee30c3e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="fa3a56948d1642b09a60c0737923d270"><span data-offset-key="fa3a56948d1642b09a60c0737923d270:0">#</span></span></span></a><span key="b9099bcd3ec044a1bee607a8ab1642de"><span offset-key="b9099bcd3ec044a1bee607a8ab1642de:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="5a1e90ba9e2943919185b51d2f72986e">*Tutorials that teach the basic concepts of Redux and how to use it*</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="6e158dd2c7424b6c9f44a37cccbcfc6c">**Intro to React, Redux, and Typescript**<span offset-key="6e158dd2c7424b6c9f44a37cccbcfc6c:1"> </span></span><a href="https://blog.isquaredsoftware.com/2020/12/presentations-react-redux-ts-intro/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="4bb81b743d794e83aca7c0251dc17c56" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="62929aeea923483294506d0f62af07ff"><span data-offset-key="62929aeea923483294506d0f62af07ff:0">https://blog.isquaredsoftware.com/2020/12/presentations-react-redux-ts-intro/</span></span></span></a><span key="db2030bfce3d4e2e841de78c4ac9e850"><span offset-key="db2030bfce3d4e2e841de78c4ac9e850:0"> Redux maintainer Mark Erikson's slideset that covers the basics of React, Redux, and TypeScript. Redux topics include stores, reducers, middleware, React-Redux, and Redux Toolkit.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="3ea2a3e50c054cc7b6fe4078dc048b3c">**Learn Modern Redux - Redux Toolkit, React-Redux Hooks, and RTK Query**<span offset-key="3ea2a3e50c054cc7b6fe4078dc048b3c:1"> </span></span><a href="https://www.learnwithjason.dev/let-s-learn-modern-redux" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8b20ad7c6a3744f99badeca05e91507e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="865f9385572a47b787e393b5cb1dacab"><span data-offset-key="865f9385572a47b787e393b5cb1dacab:0">https://www.learnwithjason.dev/let-s-learn-modern-redux</span></span></span></a><span key="83c0802b23974ea1a84e45e553b76b91"><span offset-key="83c0802b23974ea1a84e45e553b76b91:0"> An episode of the "Learn with Jason" show, with Redux maintainer Mark Erikson as guest. The episode features a live-coded app, and shows how to create a new React+TS project, add the Redux packages, and set up Redux Toolkit and React-Redux from scratch (including our recommended TS hooks configuration). It also shows how to use the upcoming RTK Query data fetching API and display that data in a UI.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="32aea1a19cd142238f2bbb5919a784a2">**Redux Tutorial: An Overview and Walkthrough**<span offset-key="32aea1a19cd142238f2bbb5919a784a2:1"> </span></span><a href="https://www.taniarascia.com/redux-react-guide/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e115fe38409848fc9ccf7674fdd85054" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="02bdd23ddab74289828620ce23857a5c"><span data-offset-key="02bdd23ddab74289828620ce23857a5c:0">https://www.taniarascia.com/redux-react-guide/</span></span></span></a><span key="1c7a815f3aa947d9a564b166f160dfa3"><span offset-key="1c7a815f3aa947d9a564b166f160dfa3:0"> A well-written tutorial from Tania Rascia that quickly explains key Redux concepts, and shows how to put together a basic Redux + React app using vanilla Redux and Redux Toolkit.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="1224d5baaec044b4abe3c1b1c4991e58">**Redux for Beginners - The Brain-Friendly Guide to Learning Redux**<span offset-key="1224d5baaec044b4abe3c1b1c4991e58:1"> </span></span><a href="https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/redux-for-beginners-the-brain-friendly-guide-to-redux/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2a9ea7592ef5446eac99fe525cdac4c9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="a36f305ccd014d11b64ced590d3b34c4"><span data-offset-key="a36f305ccd014d11b64ced590d3b34c4:0">https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/redux-for-beginners-the-brain-friendly-guide-to-redux/</span></span></span></a><span key="6f60afd7d0fb44f1a6fce3d116b891ed"><span offset-key="6f60afd7d0fb44f1a6fce3d116b891ed:0"> An easy-to-follow tutorial that builds a small todo app with Redux Toolkit and React-Redux, including data fetching.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="a22be5aabf284591b18ddc7c2e61664a">**Redux made easy with Redux Toolkit and Typescript**<span offset-key="a22be5aabf284591b18ddc7c2e61664a:1"> </span></span><a href="https://www.mattbutton.com/redux-made-easy-with-redux-toolkit-and-typescript/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1f230c87c21746989d895c26c56b342f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="ad0af3c5c308444f9c237cc7f8d40b66"><span data-offset-key="ad0af3c5c308444f9c237cc7f8d40b66:0">https://www.mattbutton.com/redux-made-easy-with-redux-toolkit-and-typescript/</span></span></span></a><span key="02fb1822aa4947fd9516a273f412f26f"><span offset-key="02fb1822aa4947fd9516a273f412f26f:0"> A helpful tutorial that shows how to use Redux Toolkit and TypeScript together to write Redux applications, and how RTK simplifies typical Redux usage.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="2716271c3bf04442b4dab24185dbbf31">**Redux: From Twitter Hype to Production**<span offset-key="2716271c3bf04442b4dab24185dbbf31:1"> </span></span><a href="https://slides.com/jenyaterpil/redux-from-twitter-hype-to-production#/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="4616cbccd3bf4a619f66f3981f6c5212" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="bd30190f5a6a4b06bebc08746df05527"><span data-offset-key="bd30190f5a6a4b06bebc08746df05527:0">https://slides.com/jenyaterpil/redux-from-twitter-hype-to-production#/</span></span></span></a><span key="7da2e5245de04193bae4f46fdb0eb70f"><span offset-key="7da2e5245de04193bae4f46fdb0eb70f:0"> A well-produced slideshow that visually steps through core Redux concepts, usage with React, project organization, and side effects with thunks and sagas. Has some good animated diagrams demonstrating how data flows through a React+Redux architecture.</span></span>

<span key="414af02696674b1e9c9de94982975f13">*Explanations of the React-Redux bindings library*</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="2c799070bd664e7f997b322f1c347a2b">**Modernizing a Legacy Redux Application with React-Redux Hooks**<span offset-key="2c799070bd664e7f997b322f1c347a2b:1"> </span></span><a href="https://app.egghead.io/playlists/modernizing-a-legacy-redux-application-with-react-hooks-c528" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e2f98e822768481fbf8275b92f6b92de" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="99c3e84c86f84d7686a8212d4a97da2a"><span data-offset-key="99c3e84c86f84d7686a8212d4a97da2a:0">https://app.egghead.io/playlists/modernizing-a-legacy-redux-application-with-react-hooks-c528</span></span></span></a><span key="fad3aef715b1450e883b151f9c40a233"><span offset-key="fad3aef715b1450e883b151f9c40a233:0"> A video series that shows the differences between the earlier </span>`connect`<span offset-key="fad3aef715b1450e883b151f9c40a233:2"> API and the newer React-Redux hooks API, and how to use those hooks in your components.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="a04f49462a8c4b799f095aca3767e8b0">**Why Redux is Useful in React Apps**<span offset-key="a04f49462a8c4b799f095aca3767e8b0:1"> </span></span><a href="https://www.fullstackreact.com/articles/redux-with-mark-erikson/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="bba8b821bf5d4de693deea6e9e5b51f1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="c396408eccfe4457bb01349050f33b36"><span data-offset-key="c396408eccfe4457bb01349050f33b36:0">https://www.fullstackreact.com/articles/redux-with-mark-erikson/</span></span></span></a><span key="b1cc3c356927411c90cf40f966728b64"><span offset-key="b1cc3c356927411c90cf40f966728b64:0"> An explanation of some of the benefits of using Redux with React, including sharing data between components and hot module reloading.</span></span>

## 

<span key="297083f206784b9e9da2c170ef419463"><span offset-key="297083f206784b9e9da2c170ef419463:0">Project-Based Tutorials</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/learning-resources#project-based-tutorials" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2b6f0c0591b241b88c4d2234352d9404" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="15344478656a4ae7b2f69375660d1445"><span data-offset-key="15344478656a4ae7b2f69375660d1445:0">#</span></span></span></a><span key="76a62622f75b4548979a5df0e47cd52f"><span offset-key="76a62622f75b4548979a5df0e47cd52f:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="3cb08eaf3c8b4ab7b537da6bbeacb809">*Tutorials that teach Redux concepts by building projects, including larger "real-world"-type applications*</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="fe98473e86c74337b0cbd477cfce8116">**Practical Redux**<span offset-key="fe98473e86c74337b0cbd477cfce8116:1"> </span></span><a href="https://blog.isquaredsoftware.com/2016/10/practical-redux-part-0-introduction/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9f4b542d373347a8af7d168610fb12a5" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="51245747bfce42cfb41a0e0c6d889dfa"><span data-offset-key="51245747bfce42cfb41a0e0c6d889dfa:0">https://blog.isquaredsoftware.com/2016/10/practical-redux-part-0-introduction/</span></span></span></a><span key="4d29d284fff7477baf34167db1fd896f"><span offset-key="4d29d284fff7477baf34167db1fd896f:0"> </span></span><a href="https://blog.isquaredsoftware.com/series/practical-redux/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0be01a50eaa84e73a80ab854a3713b11" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="fca466ed5652419d9d60838347006ba2"><span data-offset-key="fca466ed5652419d9d60838347006ba2:0">https://blog.isquaredsoftware.com/series/practical-redux/</span></span></span></a><span key="ca086eb1e4004350956e5f7b9f82b87b"><span offset-key="ca086eb1e4004350956e5f7b9f82b87b:0"> An ongoing series of posts intended to demonstrate a number of specific Redux techniques by building a sample application, based on the MekHQ application for managing Battletech campaigns. Written by Redux co-maintainer Mark Erikson. Covers topics like managing relational data, connecting multiple components and lists, complex reducer logic for features, handling forms, showing modal dialogs, and much more. (Note: this is an older series, and today we recommend newer patterns for writing Redux code. However, many of the principles in this series are still valuable.)</span></span>

## 

<span key="8eb58a747b4941d2b4df52d9e9fdcb29"><span offset-key="8eb58a747b4941d2b4df52d9e9fdcb29:0">Redux Implementation</span></span><a href="https://redux.js.org/introduction/learning-resources#redux-implementation" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="950d3c76d6184f34a14cfdc27172e079" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="920f2dbadc504eb4ba3737555b556977"><span data-offset-key="920f2dbadc504eb4ba3737555b556977:0">#</span></span></span></a><span key="5a814c65cb7244bfbbe7347409cacac7"><span offset-key="5a814c65cb7244bfbbe7347409cacac7:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="be77068d2c744359a77405c84bda7a8d">*Explanations of how Redux works internally, by writing miniature reimplementations*</span>

The RealWorld project also includes many other implementations of the front and back ends of the site, specifically intended to show how different server and client implementations of the same project and API spec compare with each other.</span></span>

    <span key="bad1d08e3a1a4aca9720de97e8c10ab4">**Redux in Action**<span offset-key="bad1d08e3a1a4aca9720de97e8c10ab4:1"> </span></span><a href="https://www.manning.com/books/redux-in-action" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0ca93b53b6064753ad2d3fba680c4b6d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="417def2e30f943febaeaf6712803d28a"><span data-offset-key="417def2e30f943febaeaf6712803d28a:0">https://www.manning.com/books/redux-in-action</span></span></span></a><span key="4e94ae10e371456ba4990e43ee9c8055"><span offset-key="4e94ae10e371456ba4990e43ee9c8055:0"> A comprehensive book that covers many key aspects of using Redux, including the basics of reducers and actions and use with React, complex middlewares and side effects, application structure, performance, testing, and much more. Does a great job of explaining the pros, cons, and tradeoffs of many approaches to using Redux. Personally recommended by Redux co-maintainer Mark Erikson.</span></span>

    <span key="a4c530d0627849308b28bdbe81e7d9ee">**The Complete Redux Book**<span offset-key="a4c530d0627849308b28bdbe81e7d9ee:1"> </span></span><a href="https://leanpub.com/redux-book" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="4b1822dd9ff34e9c8d613b50def33378" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="312d6b42cdc746ef88e3d76414497df0"><span data-offset-key="312d6b42cdc746ef88e3d76414497df0:0">https://leanpub.com/redux-book</span></span></span></a><span key="736fb0536727466c8cfd52d5a365ddb2"><span offset-key="736fb0536727466c8cfd52d5a365ddb2:0"> How do I manage a large state in production? Why do I need store enhancers? What is the best way to handle form validations? Get the answers to all these questions and many more using simple terms and sample code. Learn everything you need to use Redux to build complex and production-ready web applications. (Note: now permanently free!)</span></span>

    <span key="cf2016bc03fc452089c3bffb50785bfd">**Taming the State in React**<span offset-key="cf2016bc03fc452089c3bffb50785bfd:1"> </span></span><a href="https://www.robinwieruch.de/learn-react-redux-mobx-state-management/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="72c883db3e3d4c2fb5a75cc4881b8c36" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="0c116b465cd443c9a61158584ae98258"><span data-offset-key="0c116b465cd443c9a61158584ae98258:0">https://www.robinwieruch.de/learn-react-redux-mobx-state-management/</span></span></span></a><span key="db380f006dc44239b9e1543a01d4bc64"><span offset-key="db380f006dc44239b9e1543a01d4bc64:0"> If you have learned React with the previous book of the author called The Road to learn React, Taming the State in React will be the perfect blend to learn about basic and advanced state management in React. You will start out with learning only Redux without React. Afterward, the book shows you how to connect Redux to your React application. The advanced chapters will teach you about normalization, naming, selectors and asynchronous actions. In the end, you will set up and build a real world application with React and Redux.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="d0913c8e93c94f7d99fc50098ef4a817">**Modern React with Redux, by Stephen Grider (paid)**<span offset-key="d0913c8e93c94f7d99fc50098ef4a817:1"> </span></span><a href="https://www.udemy.com/react-redux/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a5ba4a02e1b642408be0aa63b2b73f8e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="6d11f6f0e95a481b8838d0d984792d45"><span data-offset-key="6d11f6f0e95a481b8838d0d984792d45:0">https://www.udemy.com/react-redux/</span></span></span></a><span key="5825f25d8d274734aedeacb3c5e33340"><span offset-key="5825f25d8d274734aedeacb3c5e33340:0"> Master the fundamentals of React and Redux with this tutorial as you develop apps with React Router, Webpack, and ES6. This course will get you up and running quickly, and teach you the core knowledge you need to deeply understand and build React components and structure applications with Redux.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="eef3f6f397ac4b5b8423e8e22ebdeffd">**Redux, by Tyler McGinnis (paid)**<span offset-key="eef3f6f397ac4b5b8423e8e22ebdeffd:1"> </span></span><a href="https://tylermcginnis.com/courses/redux/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="614ac33f224448cbbad443ed26693f00" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="1bf04cc6f60548df9c4bc9fa4ad04c4a"><span data-offset-key="1bf04cc6f60548df9c4bc9fa4ad04c4a:0">https://tylermcginnis.com/courses/redux/</span></span></span></a><span key="51ee3b0c3aee42c893006daf4b6a3776"><span offset-key="51ee3b0c3aee42c893006daf4b6a3776:0"> When learning Redux, you need to learn it in the context of an app big enough to see the benefits. That's why this course is huge. A better name might be </span>*"Real World Redux"*<span offset-key="51ee3b0c3aee42c893006daf4b6a3776:2">. If you're sick of "todo list" Redux tutorials, you've come to the right place. In this course we'll talk all about what makes Redux special for managing state in your application. We'll build an actual "real world" application so you can see how Redux handles edge cases like optimistic updates and error handling. We'll also cover many other technologies that work well with Redux, Firebase, and CSS Modules.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="6974210abcce40b8a1fda8373ebabaab">**Learn Redux, by Wes Bos (free)**<span offset-key="6974210abcce40b8a1fda8373ebabaab:1"> </span></span><a href="https://learnredux.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="20b87cb6b4994642bb97b77fdd18f1a9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-69326_259-69327-237__"><span data-key="ef182ff427224f12b829ee36860b44fa"><span data-offset-key="ef182ff427224f12b829ee36860b44fa:0">https://learnredux.com/</span></span></span></a><span key="6c74ea2239fa4c94a63b0650cf25dbf6"><span offset-key="6c74ea2239fa4c94a63b0650cf25dbf6:0"> A video course that walks through building 'Reduxstagram' — a simple photo app that will simplify the core ideas behind Redux, React Router and React.js</span></span>
